summaries.summary: Introduction to Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in C++. OOP organizes software design around objects rather than functions and logic.
key_points: OOP is a programming paradigm centered on data/objects
Four pillars: encapsulation, abstraction, inheritance, polymorphism

summaries.summary: Encapsulation bundles data with methods and restricts direct access using access specifiers in C++.
key_points: Encapsulation bundles data with operating methods
C++ access specifiers: public, private, protected
Class members are private by default

summaries.summary: Abstraction hides complex implementation details, implemented using abstract classes and pure virtual functions in C++.
key_points: Abstract classes contain at least one pure virtual function
Pure virtual functions are declared by assigning zero

summaries.summary: Inheritance allows classes to inherit properties and methods. C++ supports single, multiple, multilevel, hierarchical, and hybrid inheritance.
key_points: Derived class inherits from base class
Multiple inheritance types supported in C++

summaries.summary: Polymorphism means many forms, achieved through function overloading, operator overloading, and virtual functions. Demonstrated with Shape class hierarchy example.
key_points: Polymorphism via overloading and virtual functions
Example: Shape base class with Circle and Rectangle derived classes
